Posts.Content: jneumann wrote: I finished my 5th cycle of Abraxane/Avastin and had bad sores on my leg, butt and and popped a hole between my nasal passages.  This Avastin is strong stuff, so my doc pulled me off all Abraxane/Avastin for a month now and put me on high dose antibiotics.  Nothing has cleared up so we are trying a different antibiotic before finishing my 6th cycle of Abraxane/Avastin.  Anyone else have bad side effects from Avastin?  Other side effects:  calf pain, head pain (different than headaches), conjunctivitis, constipation and a few other minor things. Dx 10/10/2007, IDC, 3cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 10/16 nodes, mets, ER+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Abraxane/Avastin Side Effects jneumann pee

Posts.Content: Feb 4, 2010 12:59PM jneumann wrote: Update, am on Bactrum for the infected lessions and they seem to have started to clear up.  Got my PET today and it shows my liver mets are active again.  Have to wait until Monday to talk to my doc about what we can do if I cannot go back on Avastin due to lessions/sores.  My radiology oncologist said they may be able to do ablations to the mets if my regular onc has not other medicine.  Isn't there anything beyond Avastin?
Posts.Title: Abraxane/Avastin Side Effects jneumann pee

Posts.Content: Mar 22, 2011 09:31PM jneumann wrote: Second dose of Halaven down, no Tykerb we decided to cut that out to see if it stops the diarrhea.  now i am constipated but that has got to pass too.  besides miralux any thoughts, it does taste nasty!  am looking at spring gardening magazines and cannot wait.  hoping my friends will come plant a garden for me.  cannot wait for spring!  botanical gardens, take a deep deep sniff for me!  must smell like heaven!  sorry about the venting last week, was really a crying depressed week for me.  my doc upped my anti depressants so hope those help.  need to find someone local to talk to and make me laugh or just a good hug once in a while.  today a fresh hot cup of coffee would be good. Joann
Posts.Title: Halaven - Day 1 PJB Wanderingneedle

Posts.Content: Feb 20, 2011 01:21PM jneumann wrote: Hi, I'm new to this thread, am to start with Halaven next week and wanted to see what you wonderful ladies have to say about the side effects.  I remember having the Neupogen injections, my husband would give them to me - I was too chicken to do it myself.   But my main question is that I thought Halaven was for HER2+ patients. Joann
Posts.Title: Halaven - Day 1 PJB Wanderingneedle

Posts.Content: Feb 22, 2011 08:14AM - edited Feb 22, 2011 08:15AM by jneumann hope4us:  I will ship you some pounds anytime you need them, seems like none of the chemos have affected my appetite but I think that helps me stay stronger. Mets in liver to the point that we cannot see any clean liver, mets in more lymph nodes and one spot in my bone but the liver is the worry point.  Hope to kick this before it spreads more. Hope to start Halaven this Thursday and knock the heck out of this monster.  It does me good to get mad and ready to fight back.  I have great support, my kids came over yesterday and stayed all day to keep me entertained, they are great! Will check in again tomorrow!  Thanks for being here.
Posts.Title: Halaven - Day 1 PJB Wanderingneedle

Posts.Content: Aug 11, 2011 01:15AM jneumann wrote: Wow, there is so much information in all these threads and so many strong great women.  My hat is off to all of you!  We have to keep going and trying although some days it seems like an uphill battle.  I was on Halaven, on 2 weeks then off one week.  I finished all but the last dose in the 6th cycle, I just could not do any more I was so weak I had to come in a wheel chair and didn't even have the energy to get up on the table.  That was July 1st when we decided it was time for a break from the Halaven plus from my scans my tumor in my liver shrank from 34 mm to 4 mm so now we just wait and see if it holds, nothing before has ever held my tumors they always regrew.  As far as SE's the worse part is the depression, fatigue, low blood count and dehydration.  I have been in the hospital 5 times for dehydration, in the beginning my kidneys went into failure so we cut the Halaven down by 20% of the dosage and the Halaven worked fine for me, at least for my blood tests.  So let's keep our fingers crossed and prayers coming that my tumor doesn't start growing back, new scans due in a few weeks or longer.  I would love to stay on break forever, I can dream can't I.  I hate being tired but I hate the depression more.  Does anyone else have problems with depression?  I have been on Celexa since I was diagnosed in November 2007, so my regular doctor increased my Celexa for the depression and it seems to help, I still have one day a month that I get so depressed I could cry all day even when I was on vacation with lots of people around me.  Getting out shopping or doing lunch with someone helps, working would help but there are too many days I would have to miss because of not feeling good or being too tired.  I can sleep from 9 pm straight thru to 4 pm the next day then go to bed again at 9 pm.  I have tried the local support group but it was way too depressing for me, I know you have to be your own advocate and keep fighting, it is just that some days fighting alone stinks.  I have great friends and family plus and mainly my husband but unless you have been thru this you really don't know how it is.   But thanks for letting me ramble on and on, I would appreciate any thoughts on the depression and other SEs.  Reading this makes me feel like I am not the only one fighting this.  I was the first in my medical clinic to try Halaven and now they have put another woman on it too.  So I must be a good candidate.
Posts.Title: Halaven - Day 1 PJB Wanderingneedle

Posts.Content: Mar 12, 2010 07:48PM jneumann wrote: Hi,  Just got out of the hospital after trying to do 10 days of Xeloda/Tykerb but it gave me severe diarrhea for the 10 days and I couldn't take it any more.  They hospitalized me for dehydration and the diarrhea, ended up with my kidney creatine levels being 2.8 (normal is 1.1) and my potassium level was 1.1 and should be 3.5.  My sugar levels went up to 148 so they had to give me some insulin to lower it.  I was so stunned that all these things happened when all I anticipated was dehydration and diarrhea.  So I ended up in there a little longer than hoped but everything is back in line, kidneys just need to heal.  How can I find what other things like that may happen?
Posts.Title: Xeloda/Tykerb jneumann jneumann

Posts.Content: jneumann wrote: Anyone have any experience with Xeloda/Tykerb?  I am to start on it at the end of this week.  Herceptin attacked my heart, avastin gave me open sores that won't heal so we are trying this combo. Joann Dx 10/10/2007, IDC, 3cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 10/16 nodes, mets, ER+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Feb 19, 2010 05:16PM jneumann wrote: Super Glue!  I will try that if I get splits.  I'm being optomistic and hoping for no hand/foot syndrome as I always seem to get all the severe side effects.
Posts.Title: Xeloda/Tykerb jneumann jneumann

Posts.Content: Jan 5, 2010 02:07PM jneumann wrote: WOW!  Wow is all I can say after reading all your posts.  This is such a great group of strong women!  I am not working and cannot imagine how anyone works while going through this.  God give you strength!  I have just finished my 5th cycle (3wks on & one off) and unfortunately caught a cold so I won't be able to start my 6th cycle for a week or two.  As far as side effects, fatigue, tingling of hands and feet (was so bad that we had to reduce the Abraxane/Avastin by 20%), still tingling but not as bad.  Also have the runny eyes, runny nose, rectal bleeding and a bit of headaches.  My nose did not have nose bleeds but it was always bloody inside until a hole broke thru between nasal passages.  My thoughts and prayers for all of you.
Posts.Title: Anyone on Abraxane/Avastin jneumann anamary1

Posts.Content: Jan 5, 2010 02:11PM jneumann wrote: Should have also added, mets have shrunk when I had my CT after cycle 3.  Would I do this again?  Probably.  I just hate the fatigue, couldn't do anything for the holidays not shop, wrap, cook, visit, nothing.
Posts.Title: Anyone on Abraxane/Avastin jneumann anamary1

Posts.Content: jneumann wrote: My mets in my liver grew back and we are trying to shrink all 11 including one big mother!  I am on Abraxane/Avastin and understand it is suppose to be quite a good pair.  I have completed 3 cycles of weekly for three weeks then off a week and I will have my pet scan next week - don't feel very confident but keeping my hopes up.  Has anyone else been on this regimen?  How many cycles did you do?  I know I will most likely have to do 3 more cycles which is 12 weeks, which covers the holidays, which really stinks.  I barely have enough energy to make a meal now and am wondering if the fatigue gets worse, I think it is cummulative.  Any suggestions on how to fight the fatigue?  Also, per my doc the stats say I have 2 to 3 years and adding this regimen will increase my time.  First of all - I do not believe in stats - had many other health issues that I beat and I know many that have stayed in remission years longer than science thought possible.  Any comments? Dx 10/10/2007, IDC, 3cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 10/16 nodes, mets, ER+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Anyone on Abraxane/Avastin jneumann anamary1

Posts.Content: Sep 9, 2009 01:29AM jneumann wrote: My white blood cells were so low that we had to wait another week to continue with Abraxane.  Then they gave me an injection to boost my white blood cells, it worked.  Now I give myself an injection for the four days after chemo. I have heard that eating seafood helps boost white blood cells especially lobster.

Posts.Title: Abraxane and Avastin combo weekly b445 mgk63

Posts.Content: Sep 9, 2009 02:40AM jneumann wrote: I have liver mets that reoccured after doing the Taxol regiment so my doc put me on the Abraxane and Avastin and Zomata.  I get Abraxane every week for 3 weeks and Avastin every other week and Zomata once a month.  My white blood cell counts were low so now we are adding injections that I will give myself at home.  Worse part to me so far are the bone pains, makes it hard to walk, sit, lay, undress and go to the bathroom.  My doc gave me some morphine but I don't think that is helping.
Posts.Title: Abraxane and Avastin combo weekly b445 mgk63

Posts.Content: Aug 7, 2010 07:17PM jneumann wrote: I was diagnosed with BC in Oct 2007 at Stage IV with liver mets.  Per my onc yesterday he said they didn't think I would make it past one year with my diagnosis.  But here it is 2 1/2 years, still fighting the tumors, am on Xeloda/Tykerb, tried Taxol/Herceptin - the Herceptin played havoc with my heart but put me in remission for a little over a year.  Tried Abraxane/Avastin and this caused me too many lessions, now on the Xeloda/Tykerb but that is at a very low dose with frequent breaks so my lessions can heal and other side effects heal. When is enough enough, for me never.  My onc gives me 2 years and says I am doing fantastic but I am wondering how do you know when to go for a second opinion.  I feel my onc is doing exactly what is best for me but what if there is something better for me.  How do I know?
Posts.Title: Liver Mets...any effective treatment? njboo11 njboo11
